intro: Tithymalus commutatus var. erectus, commonly known as the upright tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
